ibis.ipl
Interface IbisIdentifier

All Superinterfaces:
Comparable<IbisIdentifier>, Serializable
public interface IbisIdentifier
extends Serializable, Comparable<IbisIdentifier>

An IbisIdentifier uniquely identifies an Ibis instance on the network.

IbisIdentifiers should be comparable with equals(), so implementations probably redefine hashCode() and equals(). When two IbisIdentifiers compare equal, they identify the same Ibis instance.

IbisIdentifiers also implement the Comparable interface, which means they can be sorted.

Method Summary
 Location location()
          Returns the Location of this Ibis instance.

          Returns a name uniquely identifying the Ibis instance to which this IbisIdentifier refers.

          Returns the name of the pool to which this Ibis instance belongs.

          Returns a human-readable but not necessarily unique string identifying the Ibis instance to which this IbisIdentifier refers.

Method Detail

location

Location location()
Returns the Location of this Ibis instance.

Returns:
the location.

poolName

String poolName()
Returns the name of the pool to which this Ibis instance belongs.

Returns:
the pool name.

name

String name()
Returns a name uniquely identifying the Ibis instance to which this IbisIdentifier refers. Names are only unique within a single Ibis pool.

Returns:
a name.

tagAsString

String tagAsString()
Returns the application tag provided when the Ibis instance with this identifier was constructed or null if none was provided. Applications should try to keep this as short as possible since these will be sent over the network many times.

Returns:
a tag.
Throws:
RuntimeException - if the current VM does not support UTF-8 encoding for strings.

tag

byte[] tag()
Returns the application tag provided when the Ibis instance with this identifier was constructed or null if none was provided. Applications should try to keep this as short as possible since these will be sent over the network many times.

Returns:
a tag.

toString

String toString()
Returns a human-readable but not necessarily unique string identifying the Ibis instance to which this IbisIdentifier refers. This method can be used for debugging prints.

Overrides:
toString in class Object
Returns:
a string representation of this IbisIdentifier.
